intro: Phyllorkis biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
